summary: An email from Jean James to FBI field offices in Washington and New York, dated July 12, 2019, discussing alleged transnational pedophilia connections among political and elite circles. It references UK political figures and operations like Operation Ore and Operation Avalanche, suggesting high-level cover-ups.

persons.name: Jean James
persons.context: The individual who sent the email to the FBI field offices, raising allegations about transnational pedophilia connections among political and elite figures.

persons.name: Lord McAlpine
persons.context: A UK political figure mentioned as denying involvement in the alleged pedophilia networks discussed in the email.

persons.name: Tony Blair
persons.context: Reportedly blocked the exposure of famous names during the UK's Operation Ore investigation into internet pedophilia activity.

connections.description: Both are UK political figures referenced in the context of alleged elite pedophilia networks and cover-ups.

events.title: Operation Ore
events.description: A UK police investigation into internet pedophilia activity that stemmed from the FBI's Operation Avalanche. It identified thousands of suspects but reportedly failed to convict any 'big fish' from elite levels of society.

events.title: Operation Avalanche
events.description: An FBI investigation in the United States into internet pedophilia that led to the UK's Operation Ore. It produced a large number of internet records but resulted in relatively few charges.

keyFacts: The email alleges that pedophiles and satanists pervade global politics, royalty, banking, corporations, and media, and are equally rife in UK and US political elites.
It claims former UK Prime Minister Tony Blair blocked the exposure of famous names during the Operation Ore investigation.
Operation Ore, stemming from the FBI's Operation Avalanche, resulted in thousands of suspects, arrests, and convictions but no major names from elite society.
The correspondence was sent to FBI field offices in Washington and New York, suggesting an attempt to alert US authorities to these transnational allegations.
